meanings.sent1: After the roller coaster ride, Sarah felt queazier than ever before.
meanings.sent2: The spoiled milk had a queazier smell than the rotten eggs.
meanings.sent3: The queazier sensation in his stomach made him regret eating the expired yogurt.
meanings.sent4: The queazier feeling crept up on her like a sneaky cat in the night.
meanings.sent5: The queazier sensation lingered, leaving a bitter taste in his mouth.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of sickness or nausea.
meanings.sent1: The queazier medicine made her grimace at the thought of taking it.
meanings.sent2: The queazier smell of the garbage made him hold his nose tightly.
meanings.sent3: The queazier taste of the strange fruit made them all laugh at their reactions.
meanings.sent4: The queazier sight of the slimy creature sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The queazier sensation in the room made everyone want to leave immediately.
